parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: Probably a fuller form of rheo; an alternate for epo in certain tenses; to utter, i.e. Speak or say.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To know, remember, appreciate.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
This; he, she, it.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To come, go.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Large, great, in the widest sense.
Persecution, affliction, distress, tribulation. From thlibo; pressure.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To wash. A prolonged form of an obsolete pluo; to 'plunge', i.e. Launder clothing.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A long robe, worn by the upper classes in the East. From stello; equipment, i.e., a 'stole' or long-fitting gown.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To whiten, make white. From leukos; to whiten.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Blood, literally, figuratively or specially; by implication, bloodshed, also kindred.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(originally: a little lamb, but diminutive force was lost), a lamb. Diminutive from aren; a lambkin.
